newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico stocks close higher on bottom-fishing.
newsitem.headline: Mexico stocks close higher on bottom-fishing.

text.p: Mexican stocks rebounded from an early decline to close higher on Thursday as bargain hunters finally stepped in to the market, traders said.
"Domestic and foreign bottom-fishing buyers stepped in. Anyone with cash to buy got rich today," a trader said.
The blue chip IPC index closed up 50.84 points, or 1.61 percent, at 3,213.33 points. Volume was very heavy, at 160 million shares traded.
Other traders and analysts said many investors were closing month-end positions, and that the bourse was also boosted by Mexican ADRs listed in New York.
